CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 10, 1955, pg. 4 reads: "Protest Rezoning - City Council heard arguments, pro and con, Tuesday, concerning the proposed ordinance to change from Class "B" to "A" property bounded by Chalfont Street, Delmont Avenue, Bolivar Way and Gearing Avenue, in the Eighteenth Ward (Beltzhoover), that wouldn't permit the establishment of a funeral home at 616 Delmont Avenue. Atty. Harry Caplan and his client, Mrs. Edith M. Whittaker Taylor, who desires to establish the funeral home...-Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Atty. Harry Caplan and his client, Edith M. Whittaker Taylor, looking at papers for Beltzhoover re-zoning hearing, in City County Building
